entry.title: Just Flight Teases UNS-1 Custom FMS for the 146 Professional
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Just Flight has recently published aÂ developer updateÂ covering their progress on the UNS-1 Custom FMS for theirÂ 146 Professional, an old style FMS released in 1982 and widely used until the early 2000s, providing GPS navigation with LNAV output to the autopilot and horizontal situation indicator. Users can toggle between the modern FMS, the UNS-1, or no FMS in the Electronic Flight Bag Configuration Menu, without reloading the aircraft.Â The new UNS-1 will be capable of loading and saving MSFS flight plans, along with full SID/STAR support with transitions and approaches. It also includes advanced features such as real-time fuel monitoring, as long as the user inputs the necessary information (passenger count, cargo, fuel quantity, etc.).Â Like the real unit, it features VNAV, but it doesnât communicate with the autopilot, making it the user has to manually manage the climbs and descents with IAS and VS, although the built-in VNAV will be able to calculate the top of descent and target vertical speed. The developer claims it is still under extensive testing, with guidance videos to come once itâs closer to release. Cover picture is courtesy of DragonRuins. entry.title: RDPresets Releases Bergen Flesland Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. RDPresets has just released their rendition of Bergen Flesland Airport (ENBR) for Microsoft Flight Simulator, the second busiest airport in Norway with a yearly average of 6 million passengers. It is an important Scandinavian destination, served by many airlines such as Scandinavian Airlines, Norwegian Air Shuttle, and WiderÃ¸e, with a significant intra-european route network.Â The origin of the airport dates back to the early 1950s, when a national military communications project secured the construction of a 1460 meter long runway, and 4 million norwegian krone were provided by the municipalities of Bergen and Fana to build a terminal and a road. Additional NATO grants in 1953 warranted a longer runway (2440 meters) and better infrastructure. A DHC-3 Otter was the first aircraft to land on Bergen Flesland, on 18 June 1954, when only 800 meters of the runway were complete. The first revenue chartered flight was a leg to Oslo, transporting SK Brann to play a football match.Â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom models, PBR texturing, 3D interior, more than a thousand clutter objects on the apron, realistic and functioning VDGS, custom ground textures, performance optimization, accurate night lighting, custom taxi signage, and ground traffic. Itâs available on theÂ RDPresets StoreÂ for roughly $21.07 or onÂ SimMarketÂ for $19.00, requiring at least 1 GB of free disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Just Flight Previews RJ Professional for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Just Flight has recently released a video showcasing the RJ Professionalâs Center Console with its all-new avionics in relation to the 146, demonstrating the functionality of each panel, from the radio stack to the flight deck door controls. The yearly traffic figures sit at less than 20 thousand passengers, with regional carriers like SkyAlps and Luxwing connecting the city to Berlin, DÃ¼sseldorf, and Hamburg, 7 times a week (as of December 2022).Â In mid-2016, there was a public poll concerning the future of the airport, because the populace was unhappy with it costing chunks of money every year, with an eventual decision to liquidate the operator company and return the license to the Italian authorities, with potential closure in case of inability to find a new operator.
